root.title: Kyzyl-Chiraa I (е-43)
root.place: Found in district Kyzyl-Chiraa on 50 km westwards Kyzyl city near the Bayan-Kol inflow of the river Ulug-Kem.
root.store: I.A.Batmanov investigated the stone and transferred to the Tyva museum in 1961.
root.general: 2 inscriptions found not far from each other in district Kyzyl-Chiraa at Bayan-Kol inflow of the river Ulug-Kem (Е 43, Е 44).
root.description: Kyzyl-Chiraa I (е-43) is made of grey sandstone. The top part is sloped. There are 5 lines of text on one face and one side of the stone. There is a sign.
root.size: Height - 1,84 m, length - 0,45 m, width - 0,13 m.
root.investigation: Adriyanov found in 1916. Investigated by S.E.Malov, H.N.Orkhun, I.A.Batmanov, A.I.Kunaa, D.D.Vasilev, I.V.Kormushin, A.M.Sherbak and others.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.191.
